meanings.definition: Weakened by old age or worn out by long use; dilapidated.
meanings.sent1: The decrepit house had creaky floors and peeling paint.
meanings.sent2: The decrepit car barely made it up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The decrepit chair groaned loudly when someone sat on it.
meanings.sent4: His decrepit phone struggled to hold a charge.
meanings.sent5: The decrepit bridge swayed dangerously in the wind.

meanings.definition: Worn out or ruined because of age or neglect.
meanings.sent1: The decrepit barn was falling apart at the seams.
meanings.sent2: The decrepit playground equipment was rusty and unsafe.
meanings.sent3: The decrepit old book had pages that crumbled at the touch.
meanings.sent4: Her decrepit shoes had holes in the soles.
meanings.sent5: The decrepit fence leaned to one side, barely standing.
